Description: Wage Garland Wars, rule a vast empire from a floating city, and defend it from the Spanish conquistadors with droves of experienced infantry.
Navigate the winding rivers and dense jungles of Bengal as you build a thriving economy to fuel unstoppable armies of elephants.
Unite the tribes of Northern Africa and set sail for Europe. Can you hold your ground against the scrambled kingdoms of Iberia?
Represented by the Hussite movement and their distinctive military tactics, including the use of gunpowder weapons.
Forge fractured kingdoms into one, defend your island from overseas incursions with disciplined yeomen levies.
Infantry and cavalry civilization representing the First and Second Bulgarian Empires.
Build a kingdom amongst the forests and rivers of Southeast Asia, utilizing battle elephants to dominate their foes.
The Eastern Roman Empire, a continuation of Roman glory in the East.
Represent medieval Scottish, Irish, and Welsh people, known for swift infantry and fast-firing siege.
One of the oldest and most populous civilizations in the world, with a history of powerful dynasties.
A nomadic Turkic people from Central Asia who formed a large confederation.
Seize control of the lucrative Indian Ocean trade routes and utilize advanced metallurgy as you build one of the wealthiest sea empires of medieval Asia.
Relive the glory of the once mighty Aksumite empire and rule over the Red Sea.
Dominating present-day northern France, Belgium, and western Germany, establishing a powerful Christian kingdom.
Carve out a sturdy kingdom in the shadow of the Caucasus Mountains and use the rugged terrain to your advantage as you repulse countless foreign invasions.
A Germanic people who played a major role in the fall of the Western Roman Empire.
Ride swift mounts across the fertile fields and open plains of western India and unleash diverse armies of sturdy warriors upon your enemies.
From the fertile plains of the Ganges to the arid steppes of Central Asia, the vast and diverse armies of Hindustan once dominated the battlefields of the subcontinent.
From the vast, empty plains of Central Asia, the nomadic Huns thundered into Europe and carved out a fearsome empire through ruthless conquest.
High in the Andes Mountains, the Incas forged a powerful empire that stretched for thousands of miles along the western coast of South America.
From the bustling ports of Venice and Genoa to the proud duchies of Milan and Florence, the Italian peninsula was a vibrant center of trade, culture, and innovation during the Middle Ages.
From their island strongholds, the Japanese samurai warriors cultivated a unique and disciplined martial tradition.

Description: From the rugged peninsula bridging mainland Asia to the islands of Japan, the Korean kingdoms forged a unique and resilient culture.
From the forests and marshes of the Baltic, the Lithuanian tribes united to forge a powerful grand duchy that stretched across Eastern Europe.
From the vast plains of Pannonia, the Magyar horsemen thundered into Europe and established a powerful kingdom in the heart of the continent.
From the tropical islands of Southeast Asia, the Malay kingdoms controlled vital trade routes and built powerful maritime empires.
Follow in the footsteps of the great Mansa Musa and become the greatest king of Western Africa.
Deep within the jungles of Central America, the Mayan civilization built magnificent cities and developed advanced knowledge of astronomy and mathematics.
From the vast steppes of Central Asia, the Mongol hordes swept across continents, forging the largest contiguous land empire in history.
From the arid plateaus of Persia, mighty empires rose and fell, leaving behind a legacy of wealth, learning, and military might.
United by faith and tradition, the Polish kingdoms rose to become a dominant force in Eastern Europe, renowned for their heavy cavalry and unwavering spirit.
Set sail for the new world, discover new routes to unknown lands and expand your trade routes to the mighty African empires.

Description: From the vast plains of Eastern Europe, the Slavic tribes forged powerful kingdoms and empires that left an enduring mark on the history of the continent.
From the kingdoms of Iberia, the Spanish conquistadors embarked on voyages of exploration and conquest that reshaped the world.
From the vast steppes of Central Asia, the Tatar hordes emerged as a formidable power, their swift horsemen striking fear into the hearts of their enemies.
From the heart of the Holy Roman Empire, the Teutonic Knights forged a powerful state through conquest and colonization.
From the steppes of Central Asia, the Turkish tribes migrated westward and established mighty empires that spanned continents.
From the fertile deltas of Southeast Asia, the Vietnamese kingdoms fiercely defended their independence against powerful neighbors.
From the fjords of Scandinavia, the Viking longboats carried fierce warriors across the seas to raid and conquer vast territories.
